contentrichtext.text: This article is about [[communication]]s systems in the [[Marshall Islands]]. In 2010, the [[Majuro]] and [[Kwajalein Atoll]] were connected to the Internet using the [[HANTRU-1]] [[undersea cable]] to provide high-speed bandwidth. Faster Internet service was rolled out to Majuro and Ebeye on April 1, 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marshallislandsjournal.com/Journal%20March%205,%202010.html |title=NTA cuts internet rates |publisher=The Marshall Islands Journal |author=GIFF JOHNSON |date=March 5, 2010 |accessdate=2010-07-27}}</ref> ==Publications== '''[[Newspaper]]s - Marshall Islands Journal:''' '''Weekly national newspaper:''' [[Tabloid (newspaper format)|tabloid]] <br> The Marshall Islands Journal is a dual language, once a week publication. It is the newspaper of record for the Marshall Islands. ==Telephone== '''[[Telephone]]s - main lines in use:''' 3,000 (1994) '''Telephones - mobile cellular:''' 280 (1994) '''Telephone system:''' [[teleprinter|telex]] services <br>''domestic:'' [[Majuro Atoll]] and [[Ebeye]] and [[Kwajalein]] islands have regular, seven-digit, direct-dial telephones; other islands interconnected by shortwave radio, telephone (used mostly for government purposes) <br>''international:'' [[satellite]] earth stations - 2 [[Intelsat]] ([[Pacific Ocean]]); US Government satellite communications system on Kwajalein ==Radio== '''[[Radio]] [[broadcasting|broadcast]] stations:''' AM 3, FM 4, shortwave 0 (1998) Stations included are: * [[V7AB|V7AB 1098]] (State-run, by [[Marshall Islands Broadcasting Company]], national coverage) * [[American Forces Network|V7AFN 1224]] [[Kwajalein]] (military, [[NPR]]) * [[Micronesia Heatwave|V7RR 1557]] Micronesia Heatwave (commercial) * [[V7EMON|V7EMON 95.5]] * [[V7AB|V7AB 97.9]] * [[American Forces Network|V7EAGLE 99.9]] [[Kwajalein]] (military, Country) * [[American Forces Network|V7DJ 101.1]] [[Kwajalein]] (military, Active Rock) * [[American Forces Network|AFN 102.1]] [[Kwajalein]] (military, Hot AC) * [[V7AA|V7AA 104.1]] - Religious '''Radios:''' NA ==Television== '''[[Television]] broadcast stations:''' 3 (of which two are US military stations) (1997) (stations are: [[Marshall Islands Broadcasting Company|MBC-TV]], [[AFRTS|CPN (AFN) - Central Pacific Network]] (Channel 1) - [[AFRTS|CPN (AFN) - Central Pacific Network]] (Channel 2)) '''Televisions:''' NA ==Internet== '''[[Internet Service Provider]]s (ISPs):''' 1<ref>{{cite web|author=Aenet Rowa |url=http://www.yokwe.net/modules.php?op=modload&name=News&file=article&sid=501 |title=Marshall Islands National Telecommunications Authority Gets Its Own Internet Link-Up |publisher=Yokwe Online |date=July 20, 2003 |accessdate=2010-07-27}}</ref> '''[[Country code]] (Top level domain):''' MH Not active since 1996-1997 when the ISP "MH" was founded, no websites are currently registered in domain ==Authority== The majority of communication is under the responsibility of '''Marshall Islands National Telecommunications Authority'''. ==Notes== {{reflist}} {{Communications in Oceania}} [[Category:Communications in the Marshall Islands| ]] {{Marshalls-stub}}
